rows.FUNNEL LEVEL — FULL MODEL MAP (F0-F20): Nilo as Dan Crowley. Content → recruiting → selling the model. This is the meta business.
The funnel level is Nilo doing the Dan Crowley play:
1. Making content that demonstrates the system (Dan Crowley the creator)
2. Running the funnel that recruits people into the system (Dan Crowley the recruiter)
This is both the first business AND the recruiting engine.
The content recruits. The recruits build businesses. The businesses become content.
Nilo doesn't need a team for this. This is Nilo + Claude + the Trade.
Everything else flows from this level working.

rows.col_3: What It Covers
Why Nilo is making content. What the funnel is trying to achieve. Who it's for. What success looks like.
rows.col_4: Why Dan Crowley makes YouTube videos

rows.col_3: Nilo's positioning. YC/Greylock-backed founder + coordination theory + Atlantic Forest. The unique story.
rows.col_4: Dan Crowley's personal brand as a closer/sales expert

rows.col_3: What content Nilo makes. YouTube (long form), Twitter/X (threads), LinkedIn (professional), podcasts (guest). Cadence. Topics. Format.
Nilo's YouTube specifically. Scripting (Claude helps). Hooks. Thumbnails. SEO. Publishing cadence. The first 20 videos.
The advertorial engine output. Fernando Oliver swipe file model. One lead magnet per Trade model. Distribution.
rows.col_4: Fernando Oliver's swipe file / Olympia case study

rows.col_3: Kit (ConvertKit) landing pages. One per lead magnet. Template. Copy. Design. A/B testing.
Nurture sequences per audience. PM co-founder sequence. Expert sequence. Investor sequence. General audience.
Outbound recruiting via cold email. ListKit-style infrastructure. Templates per role. Volume. Deliverability. Follow-up.
rows.col_4: Dan Crowley co-founded ListKit for this exact thing

rows.col_3: LinkedIn, Upwork, AngelList, Twitter DMs, university job boards. Where to post. How to screen. How to funnel to MC conversation.
Every person recruited helps recruit the next. MC tells their network. PM co-founders tell theirs. Natural viral loop.
Typeform/Tally. Role-specific applications. Screening criteria. Auto-responses. Pipeline management.
How the MC conducts recruiting conversations. Conversation guides. Recording setup. Evaluation criteria.
Specific funnel for investors. Content → site access → watch the series → talk to Nilo. Different from recruiting funnel.
Tracking every stage. Content views → opt-ins → applications → conversations → offers → accepts. Conversion rates. Bottlenecks.
The Trade as a course. "How to build your own operating model." Packaging. Pricing. Distribution.
rows.col_4: Client Ascension IS a course/coaching product

rows.col_3: Building custom Trades for other companies. Pricing. Scope. Delivery. Quality standards.
The community of people who have gone through the funnel. Slack/Discord. Content. Events. The network.
Nilo as guest on other podcasts. Nilo interviewing interesting people. Cross-pollination with MC content.
Testimonials. Case studies. Cast page as social proof. "Here's everyone who's working on this."
rows.col_4: Client Ascension testimonials / Olympia case study

rows.col_3: Tools. Automation. Who does what. How the funnel runs day-to-day without Nilo doing everything.
rows.col_4: Client Ascension ops (Andre Haykal runs this)

rows.col_3: What happens when the funnel works. More content. More lead magnets. More cold email. More platforms. Paid ads (post-funding).

rows.FUNNEL LEVEL — FULL MODEL MAP (F0-F20): Week 0: F0 (thesis) + F1 (personal brand) + F2 (content strategy) = know what you're making and why
Week 1: F3 (first YouTube video) + F4 (first lead magnet) + F5 (first landing page)
Week 2: F6 (email sequence live) + F7 (cold email starts) + F8 (platforms posted)
Week 3: F9 (first recruits start recruiting) + F10 (applications flowing) + F11 (MC conversations starting)
Week 4+: F12 (investor funnel activated once content library exists)
Nilo does F0-F5 with Claude in Week 0-1. That's the seed.
F7-F8 (cold email + platforms) can run in parallel — admin handles volume, Nilo writes templates.
By Week 3, the funnel is self-sustaining: content recruits → recruits produce → production becomes content.
